search_parameters.q: Client Perceptions of School Effectiveness: A Reciprocal Causation Model for Students and their Parents. Grandjean, Burke D. Vaughn, E. Sidney, III Sociology of Education

search_information.query_displayed: Client Perceptions of School Effectiveness: A Reciprocal Causation Model for Students and their Parents. Grandjean, Burke D. Vaughn, E. Sidney, III Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: Client perceptions of school effectiveness: A reciprocal causation model for students and their parents
organic_results.snippet: Separate surveys of 229 students and their parents from a single public high school provide data for an examination of the sources of individual-level variation in perceptions of school effectiveness. We treat students and parents as mutually significant others, and therefore estimate a simultaneous-equation model that incorporates a reciprocal causal link between student and parent perceptions of effectiveness. Contrary to most previous work on student socialization and attitude formation, we find that parents' opinions of the school are affected …

publication_info.summary: BD Grandjean, ES Vaughn III - Sociology of Education, 1981 - JSTOR
